com.oracle.tools.deferred
Class Ensured<T>

java.lang.Object
  com.oracle.tools.deferred.Ensured<T>
All Implemented Interfaces:
Deferred<T>
public class Ensured<T>
extends Object
implements Deferred<T>

An Ensured is a specialized Deferred implementation that does it's best to guarantee a non-null reference will be returned when a call to get() is made. Ensured will suitably wait and retry until the object becomes available, for some maximum amount of time.

ie: An Ensured is a Deferred adapter.

If a non-null reference can not be acquired with in a specified period of time, or the adapted Deferred throws an ObjectNotAvailableException, a ObjectNotAvailableException is immediately (re-)thrown.

The default behavior of get() is to attempt to acquire the underlying resource from the specified Deferred, waiting for at most the DEFAULT_TOTAL_RETRY_DURATION_SECS seconds (not including the time the adapted Deferred takes to perform get()). If the adapted Deferred fails to provide the required object, the Ensured will wait a default "poll" period of DEFAULT_RETRY_DURATION_MS.

Copyright (c) 2012. All Rights Reserved. Oracle Corporation.
Oracle is a registered trademark of Oracle Corporation and/or its affiliates.

Author:
Brian Oliver

Field Summary
static long DEFAULT_RETRY_DURATION_MS
          The number of milliseconds to wait between attempting to acquire the object from the specified Deferred.
static long DEFAULT_TOTAL_RETRY_DURATION_SECS
          The total number of seconds to retry acquiring the object from the specified Deferred before giving up.

getDeferred

Returns:

get

public T get()
      throws ObjectNotAvailableException
Attempts to obtain the underlying object.

Specified by:
get in interface Deferred<T>
Returns:
the object of type T or null if it's not ready to be acquired (but may become available at some time in the future)
Throws:
ObjectNotAvailableException - when the Deferred implementation can't produce the requested resource. When this exception is thrown a program may safely assume that the required object will never be become available

getDeferredClass

public Class<T> getDeferredClass()
Obtains the Class of the Deferred reference. ie: the Class that a call to Deferred.get().getClass() should return if/when the Deferred object becomes available.

This method is important as it allows applications to determine an expected type of returned object, even when the actual object may not, or ever become available.

Specified by:
getDeferredClass in interface Deferred<T>
Returns:
the Class of the Deferred object
